title: Compare ruler portraits (Henry VIII and Khafre)

content.question: The work on the left is Henry VIII (1540) by Hans Holbein The Younger; the work on the right is Chefren, created about 2500 B.C.E. in Egypt. Discuss the ways in which the artists of these works convey the power and authority of each ruler.

frqParts.text: The work on the left is Henry VIII (1540) by Hans Holbein The Younger; the work on the right is Chefren, created about 2500 B.C.E. in Egypt. Discuss the ways in which the artists of these works convey the power and authority of each ruler.

topic.text: 2.1: Cultural Contexts of Ancient Mediterranean Art

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Describe visual elements of a work of art (or group of related works of art), including-  a. form.  b. style.  c. materials.  d. technique.  e. content.
